alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 12:07AM EST until February 01 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Covington...down to Riverton. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River at Lafayette. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash from a combination of precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on partially frozen ground. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 01... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma. * WHEN...Until Thursday, February 01. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Park in southern Montezuma begins to flood. Higher bottomlands begin to flood. Water backs up most local tributaries. River water is at the top of some private levees. Lowest county roads begin to flood. Parke CR 75 W begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM EST Thursday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.9 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon.this afternoon by around 100 PM EST /noon CST/.
